TITLE: Jamie Dimon says a recession is 'likely outcome' from Trump's tariff turmoil
The oil-rich Gulf states are better-positioned to weather the tariff storm — but crashing crude prices could spell trouble
SUMMARY: The countries of the GCC — Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, and Qatar — hold approximately 32.6% of the world's proven crude oil reserves.

TITLE: China says it will continue to take 'resolute and forceful' countermeasures as U.S. tariffs kick in
SUMMARY: China's foreign ministry reiterated Wednesday that it will take "resolute and forceful" measures to protect its own interests.

TITLE: Trump's triple-digit tariff essentially cuts off most trade with China, says economist
SUMMARY: President Trump's tariff increase on imports from China would basically end most trade between that country and the U.S., according to economist Erica York.

TITLE: Inflation rate eases to 2.4% in March, lower than expected; core at 4-year low
SUMMARY: The consumer price index fell a seasonally adjusted 0.1% in March, putting the 12-month inflation rate at 2.4%, down from 2.8% in February.

TITLE: European Union to put countermeasures to U.S. tariffs on hold for 90 days
SUMMARY: EU members had voted in favor of the package on Wednesday in response to U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum.

TITLE: Tanking oil prices could more than double Saudi Arabia's deficit to $75 billion and threaten spending plans: Goldman Sachs economist
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia needs oil at more than $90 a barrel to balance its budget. Goldman Sachs this week lowered its Brent crude price forecast for 2025 to $62 a barrel.

TITLE: Consumer sentiment tumbles in April as inflation fears spike, University of Michigan survey shows
SUMMARY: The University of Michigan consumer survey's mid-month reading on sentiment fell to 50.8.

TITLE: Wholesale prices unexpectedly fell 0.4% in March, showing easing inflation backdrop ahead of tariffs
SUMMARY: The producer price index, considered a leading indicator for pipeline inflation pressures, declined a seasonally adjusted 0.4% for the month.

TITLE: Fed's Kashkari says rising bond yields, falling dollar show investors are moving on from the U.S.
SUMMARY: The trends are running counter to what you might normally see, the central bank official told CNBC.

TITLE: UK economy expands by 0.5% in February, more than expected
SUMMARY: U.K. GDP rose by 0.5% on a monthly basis, far more than the 0.1% forecast by analysts.

TITLE: Fed Governor Waller sees tariff inflation as 'transitory' in 'tush push' comparison
SUMMARY: The central banker embraced a term that got the central bank in trouble during the last bout of inflation.

TITLE: Unemployment fears hit worst levels since Covid as tariffs fuel inflation outlook, Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Consumer worries grew over inflation, unemployment and the stock market as the global trade war heated up in March.

TITLE: Global trade outlook has 'deteriorated sharply' amid Trump tariff uncertainty, WTO warns
SUMMARY: The World Trade Organization has warned that the outlook for global trade has "deteriorated sharply" in the wake of President Donald Trump's tariffs regime.

TITLE: Retail sales increased 1.4% in March, greater than expected
SUMMARY: Retail sales were expected to increase 1.2% in March, according to the Dow Jones consensus.

TITLE: China targets U.S. services and other areas as it decries 'meaningless' tariff hikes on goods
SUMMARY: Beijing has wielded a wide range of punitive measures in recent days to strike back at Washington, including steps targeting American services sector.
